description:
Hematoma and Spring Cleaning: 
Trail length: 1km
Level of Difficulty: Hematoma - Most difficult  / Spring Cleaning -difficult

Rating: Hematoma 4/5  Spring cleaning 3.5/5
A short uphill from town, go straight uphill from the flashing light to 4th, 
go right to the dead end, go left  but bear right after 100 metres.  This is Columbia-Kootenay rd. and it takes you to a gate that you ride around.  Head  to the clearing on the right (200m from the gate).  You will see four 
tailheads.  From left to right they are Hematoma, Red Dwarf, Spring Cleaning and Cemetery.  Hematoma has some 60 degree rock faces, lots of steep sandy 
chutes and a bunch of high speed twisty turnies.  It puts you out onto the highway(3B) which is about 2km from town up a steep hill - not too bad if you 
are patient...and fit.  Spring Cleaning is a tamed down version of Hematoma with a few more loose rocky sections.  This trail spits you out onto the highway in the same spot as Hematoma.  Both of these trails can be ripped in 
under 10 minutes if you flow them.
title: Hematoma and Spring Cleaning
